intro: Derris nicoyensis, commonly known as the Nicoyan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small yellowish flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its toxic properties, it is not commonly cultivated but is of interest in botanical studies.
